items.title: Yanks' Bird scratched with lower back tightness
items.summary: Greg Bird was scratched from the Yankees' lineup on Monday with lower back tightness about one hour before they played the Rays at Citi Field. Tyler Austin replaced him at first base and in the ninth spot in the batting order.
items.content: Greg Bird was scratched from the Yankees' lineup on Monday with lower back tightness about one hour before they played the Rays at Citi Field. Tyler Austin replaced him at first base and in the ninth spot in the batting order.

alternate.title: Yanks' Bird scratched with lower back tightness

items.title: Eppler reflects on mentor Michael's passing
items.summary: Just across his desk, on top of a bookshelf, Angels general manager Billy Eppler keeps a photo of him and Gene "Stick" Michael on the field at Yankee Stadium after the 2009 World Series.
items.content: Just across his desk, on top of a bookshelf, Angels general manager Billy Eppler keeps a photo of him and Gene "Stick" Michael on the field at Yankee Stadium after the 2009 World Series.

alternate.title: Eppler reflects on mentor Michael's passing

items.title: Back Tuesday, Gentry limited to pinch-running
items.summary: The Orioles will have outfielder Craig Gentry available Tuesday for the second game of the series against the Blue Jays, manager Buck Showalter said said before Monday's series opener at Rogers Centre.
items.content: The Orioles will have outfielder Craig Gentry available Tuesday for the second game of the series against the Blue Jays, manager Buck Showalter said said before Monday's series opener at Rogers Centre.

alternate.title: Back Tuesday, Gentry limited to pinch-running
